alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 19 at 9:20PM EST until January 20 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches, locally higher in western Greenbrier County. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, resulting in blowing and drifting snow and wind chills between 10 and 20 degrees below zero. * WHERE...In Virginia, Tazewell County. In West Virginia, Mercer, Summers and Western Greenbrier Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Drifting snow may recovered previously cleared roads. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia and frostbite if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sub-zero wind chills are expected again Saturday night.
info.instruction: If you venture outdoors, please wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
